001package imagingbook.pub.corners.subpixel;
002
003import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE;
004import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
005import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
006import static imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix.add;
007import static imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix.distL2;
008import static imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix.dotProduct;
009import static imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix.multiply;
010import static imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix.normL2;
011
012import imagingbook.lib.util.Enums.Description;
013
014/**
015 * The common interface for all sub-pixel locator classes.
016 * @see QuadraticTaylor
017 * @see QuadraticLeastSquares
018 * @see Quartic
019 * @author WB
020 * @version 2021/01/19
021 */
022public abstract class SubpixelMaxInterpolator {
023        
024        /**
025         * Tries to locate the sub-pixel maximum from the 9 discrete sample values
026         * (s0,...,s8) taken from a 3x3 neighborhood, arranged in the following order:
027         * <pre>
028         * s4 s3 s2
029         * s5 s0 s1
030         * s6 s7 s8
031         * </pre>
032         * The center value (s0) is assumed to be at position (0,0).
033         * @param s a vector containing 9 sample values in the order described above
034         * @return a 3-element array [x,y,z], with the estimated maximum position (x,y) and the associated max. value (z). 
035         * The position is relative to the center coordinate (0,0).
036         * {@code null} is returned if the maximum position could not be located.
037         */
038        public abstract float[] getMax(float[] s);
039        
040        /**
041         * Enumeration of keys for {@link SubpixelMaxInterpolator} methods.
042         */
043        public enum Method {
044                @Description("Quadratic Taylor Interpolation") QuadraticTaylor,
045                @Description("Quadratic Least-Squares Interpolation") QuadraticLeastSquares,
046                @Description("Quartic Interpolation") Quartic,
047                @Description("No Interpolation") None;
048        }
049        
050        /**
051         * Creates a specific {@link SubpixelMaxInterpolator} instance based on the supplied
052         * {@link Method} key.
053         * @param m the method
054         * @return a new {@link SubpixelMaxInterpolator} instance
055         */
056        public static SubpixelMaxInterpolator getInstance(Method m) {
057                switch(m) {
058                case QuadraticTaylor: return new QuadraticTaylor();
059                case QuadraticLeastSquares: return new QuadraticLeastSquares();
060                case Quartic: return new Quartic();
061                case None: return null;
062                }
063                return null;
064        }
065        
066        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
067        
068        /**
069         * 2D interpolator using second-order Taylor expansion to find the coefficients
070         * of the quadratic interpolating polynomial 
071         * <pre>f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2  + c_5 xy</pre>
072         * The resulting function fits exactly the 5 on-axis samples 
073         * (s[0], s[1], s[3], s[5], s[7]) but in general does not pass
074         * through the outer diagonal samples (s[2], s[4], s[6], s[8]).
075         * Book version (Alg. 'FindMaxQuadraticTaylor').
076         */
077        public static class QuadraticTaylor extends SubpixelMaxInterpolator {
078                
079                private final double[] c = new double[6];       // polynomial coefficients
080
081                @Override
082                public float[] getMax(float[] s) {
083                        c[0] = s[0];
084                        c[1] = (s[1] - s[5]) / 2;
085                        c[2] = (s[7] - s[3]) / 2;
086                        c[3] = (s[1] - 2*s[0] + s[5]) / 2;
087                        c[4] = (s[3] - 2*s[0] + s[7]) / 2;
088                        c[5] = (-s[2] + s[4] - s[6] + s[8]) / 4;
089                        
090                        double d = (4*c[3]*c[4] - sqr(c[5]));   // determinant of Hessian
091                        
092                        if (d < EPSILON_DOUBLE || c[3] >= 0) {  // undefined or not a maximum
093                                return null;
094                        }
095                        
096                        // max position:
097                        float x = (float) ((c[2]*c[5] - 2*c[1]*c[4]) / d);
098                        float y = (float) ((c[1]*c[5] - 2*c[2]*c[3]) / d);
099                        // max value:
100                        float z = (float) (c[0] + c[1]*x + c[2]*y + c[3]*x*x + c[4]*y*y + c[5]*x*y);
101                        return new float[] {x, y, z};
102                }
103        }
104        
105        /**
106         * 2D interpolator using second-order Taylor expansion to find the coefficients
107         * of the quadratic interpolating polynomial 
108         * <pre>f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2  + c_5 xy</pre>
109         * The resulting function fits exactly the 5 on-axis samples 
110         * (s[0], s[1], s[3], s[5], s[7]) but in general does not pass
111         * through the outer diagonal samples (s[2], s[4], s[6], s[8]).
112         * Alternate version using explicit inverse Hessian.
113         */
114        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
115        private static class QuadraticTaylorAlt extends SubpixelMaxInterpolator {
116
117                @Override
118                public float[] getMax(float[] s) {
119                        double[] g = {                                                  // the gradient
120                                        (s[1] - s[5]) / 2, 
121                                        (s[7] - s[3]) / 2};     
122                        
123                        double H00 = s[1] - 2*s[0] + s[5];              // elements of the Hessian matrix
124                        double H11 = s[3] - 2*s[0] + s[7];
125                        double H01 = (s[4] + s[8] - s[2] - s[6]) / 4;                   
126                        double d = H00 * H11 - sqr(H01);                // = det(H)
127                        
128                        if (d < EPSILON_DOUBLE || H00 >= 0) {   // not a maximum (minimum or saddle point)
129                                return null;
130                        }
131                        
132                        double[][] Hi = {                       // inverse Hessian
133                                        { H11 / d, -H01 / d}, 
134                                        {-H01 / d,  H00 / d}};  
135                        
136                        double[] delta = multiply(Hi, g);
137                        double[] xy = multiply(-1, delta);                              // maximum position
138                        double q = s[0] - 0.5 * dotProduct(g, delta);   // maximum value
139                        return new float[] {(float) xy[0], (float) xy[1], (float) q};
140                }
141        }
142        
143        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
144        
145        /**
146         * 2D interpolator based on least-squares fitting a quadratic polynomial 
147         * <pre>f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2  + c_5 xy</pre>
148         * to the supplied sample values.
149         * Book Alg. 'FindMaxQuadraticLeastSquares'.
150         */
151        public static class QuadraticLeastSquares extends SubpixelMaxInterpolator {
152                
153                private final double[] c = new double[6];       // polynomial coefficients
154
155                @Override
156                public float[] getMax(float[] s) {
157                        c[0] = (5 * s[0] + 2 * s[1] - s[2] + 2 * s[3] - s[4] + 2 * s[5] - s[6] + 2 * s[7] - s[8]) / 9;
158                        c[1] = (s[1] + s[2] - s[4] - s[5] - s[6] + s[8]) / 6;
159                        c[2] = (-s[2] - s[3] - s[4] + s[6] + s[7] + s[8]) / 6;
160                        c[3] = (-2 * s[0] + s[1] + s[2] - 2 * s[3] + s[4] + s[5] + s[6] - 2 * s[7] + s[8]) / 6;
161                        c[4] = (-2 * s[0] - 2 * s[1] + s[2] + s[3] + s[4] - 2 * s[5] + s[6] + s[7] + s[8]) / 6;
162                        c[5] = (-s[2] + s[4] - s[6] + s[8]) / 4;
163                        
164                        double d = (4*c[3]*c[4] - sqr(c[5]));
165                        
166                        if (d < EPSILON_DOUBLE || c[3] >= 0) {  // not a maximum (minimum or saddle point)
167                                return null;
168                        }
169                        
170                        // max position:
171                        float x = (float) ((c[2]*c[5] - 2*c[1]*c[4]) / d);
172                        float y = (float) ((c[1]*c[5] - 2*c[2]*c[3]) / d);
173                        // max value:
174                        float z = (float) (c[0] + c[1]*x + c[2]*y + c[3]*x*x + c[4]*y*y + c[5]*x*y);
175                        return new float[] {x, y, z};
176                }
177        }
178        
179        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
180        
181        /**
182         * 2D interpolator based on fitting a 'quartic' (i.e., 4th-order) polynomial
183         * <br>
184         * f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2 + c_5 x y + c_6 x^2 y + c_7 x y^2 + c_8 x^2 y^2  
185         * <br>
186         * to the supplied sample values. The interpolation function passes through
187         * all sample values. The local maximum cannot be found in closed form but 
188         * is found iteratively, which is not guaranteed to succeed.
189         * @see SubpixelMaxInterpolator#getMax(float[])
190         */
191        public static class Quartic extends SubpixelMaxInterpolator {
192                static int DefaultMaxIterations = 20;   // iteration limit
193                static double DefaulMaxDelta = 1e-6;    // smallest x/y move to continue search 
194                static double DefaultMaxRad = 1.0;              // x/y search boundary (-xyLimit, +xyLimit)
195                
196                private final int maxIterations;
197                private final double maxDelta;
198                private final double maxRad;
199                
200                private final double[] c = new double[9];       // polynomial coefficients
201                
202                // -----------------------------------------------------------
203                
204                public Quartic() {
205                        this(DefaultMaxIterations, DefaulMaxDelta, DefaultMaxRad);
206                }
207                                
208                public Quartic(int maxIterations, double maxDelta, double maxRad) {
209                        this.maxIterations = maxIterations;
210                        this.maxDelta = maxDelta;
211                        this.maxRad = maxRad;
212                }
213                
214                @Override
215                public float[] getMax(float[] s) {
216                        c[0] = s[0];
217                        c[1] = (s[1] - s[5]) / 2;
218                        c[2] = (s[7] - s[3]) / 2;
219                        c[3] = (s[1] - 2 * s[0] + s[5]) / 2;
220                        c[4] = (s[3] - 2 * s[0] + s[7]) / 2;
221                        c[5] = (-s[2] + s[4] - s[6] + s[8]) / 4;
222                        c[6] = (-s[2] + 2 *s[3] - s[4] + s[6] - 2 * s[7] + s[8]) / 4;
223                        c[7] = (-2 * s[1] + s[2] - s[4] + 2 * s[5] - s[6] + s[8]) / 4;
224                        c[8] = s[0] + (-2 * s[1] + s[2] - 2 * s[3] + s[4] - 2 * s[5] + s[6] - 2 * s[7] + s[8]) / 4;
225                        
226                        // iteratively find the max location:
227                        boolean done = false;
228                        int n = 0;
229                        double[] xCur = {0, 0};
230                        double H00 = 0, H11 = 0, H01 = 0, d = 0;
231                        while (!done && n < maxIterations && normL2(xCur) < maxRad) {
232                                double[] g = this.getGradient(xCur);
233                                double[][] H = this.getHessian(xCur);
234                                H00 = H[0][0];
235                                H11 = H[1][1];
236                                H01 = H[0][1];
237                                d = H00 * H11 - sqr(H01);
238                                if (isZero(d)) {
239                                        throw new RuntimeException(Quartic.class.getSimpleName() + ": zero determinant");
240                                }
241                                double[][] Hi = {                       // inverse Hessian
242                                                { H11 / d, -H01 / d}, 
243                                                {-H01 / d,  H00 / d}};  
244                                double[] xNext = add(xCur, multiply(multiply(-1, Hi), g));
245                                if (distL2(xCur, xNext) < maxDelta) {
246                                        done = true;
247                                }
248                                else {
249                                        xCur[0] = xNext[0];
250                                        xCur[1] = xNext[1];
251                                        n = n + 1;
252                                }
253                        }
254                        
255                        boolean isMax = (d > 0) && (H00 < 0);   // false if saddle point or relative minimum
256                        
257                        if (done && isMax) {
258                                float z = (float) getInterpolatedValue(xCur);
259                                return new float[] {(float) xCur[0], (float) xCur[1], z};
260                        }
261                        else {
262                                return null;
263                        }
264                }
265                
266                private double getInterpolatedValue(double[] X) {
267                        final double x = X[0];
268                        final double y = X[1];
269                        return c[0] + c[1]*x + c[2]*y + c[3]*x*x + c[4]*y*y
270                                                + c[5]*x*y + c[6]*x*x*y + c[7]*x*y*y + c[8]*x*x*y*y;
271                }
272                
273                private double[] getGradient(double[] X) {
274                        return this.getGradient(X[0], X[1]);
275                }
276
277                private double[] getGradient(double x, double y) {
278                        double gx = c[1] + 2*c[3]*x + c[5]*y + 2*c[6]*x*y + c[7]*y*y + 2*c[8]*x*y*y;
279                        double gy = c[2] + c[5]*x + 2*c[4]*y + 2*c[7]*x*y + c[6]*x*x + 2*c[8]*x*x*y;
280                        return new double[] {gx, gy};
281                }
282                
283                private double[][] getHessian(double[] X) {
284                        return this.getHessian(X[0], X[1]);
285                }
286                
287                private double[][] getHessian(double x, double y) {
288                        final double H00 = 2*(c[3] + y*(c[6] + c[8]*y));
289                        final double H11 = 2*(c[4] + x*(c[7] + c[8]*x));
290                        final double H01 = c[5] + 2*c[6]*x + 2*c[7]*y + 4*c[8]*x*y;
291                        double[][] Hi = {
292                                        { H00, H01}, 
293                                        { H01, H11}};
294                        return Hi;
295                }
296                
297        }
298}
